description: Uncertain; perhaps from the Hebrew name of Joram, who “brought with him [to King David] vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass” (Bible (King James Version), 2 Samuel 8:10; compare Jeroboam); or from Arabic جَرَّة‎ (jarra, “earthen receptacle”).

entries.meaning: A large vessel for drinking (usually alcoholic beverages).
examples: Then come, put the jorum about, / And let us be merry and clever, / Our hearts and our liquors are stout, / Here's the Three Jolly Pigeons for ever.

entries.meaning: The contents, or quantity of the contents, of such a vessel.
